newsitem.title: FINLAND: Metra unit to supply power plant to Vaasa.
newsitem.headline: Metra unit to supply power plant to Vaasa.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Metra Oy Ab's Wartsila Diesel unit said on Friday it would supply a diesel combined power plant to Wasa Pilot Power Plant Oy in Vaasa.
"The 38 megawatt (MW) power plant will be built on the site of the existing Vaskiluoto power plant in Vaasa," Wartsila Diesel said in a statement.
The value of the entire investment project was 160 million markka.
Wasa Pilot Power Plant is jointly owned by Wartsila Diesel, Etela-Pohjanmaan Voima Oy, Vaasan Sahko Oy and ABB Power Oy .
The new plant, due for completion on April 1, 1998, will be connected to the national electricity grid and the local district heating network, Wartsila Diesel said.
The diesel combined cycle power plant will offer fuel savings and reduced emissions, it said.

The electrical efficiency of the plant will be 53 percent, to be further raised to 55 percent, while conventional power plants reach an efficiency level of about 40 percent and diesel power plants up to 46 percent, Wartsila Diesel said.
The electrical efficiency of a power plant refers to the proportion of total energy available as electrical output.
